intro: Archiphysalis chamaesarachoides, commonly known as the cushion plant, is a low-growing succulent native to the arid regions of South America. It forms dense, compact cushions or mats, which help it conserve moisture and withstand harsh environmental conditions. The plant has fleshy, thick leaves that store water, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its slow growth and unique appearance, it is a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping.
